content.question: Carlos finds a correlation of <math alttext="negative point 76" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>.76</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> between outside temperature and degree of depression in a sample of <math alttext="450" overflow="scroll"><mn>450</mn></math> American citizens. Which of the following can be concluded from the research finding?

choices.label: Cold temperatures cause people to become depressed.
As outside temperature increases, people’s depression levels decrease.
No conclusions can be drawn because the sample was limited to only American citizens.
Depression can be alleviated with exposure to warm outside temperatures.

content.answer: As outside temperature increases, people’s depression levels decrease.

topic.text: 5.4: Selection of Categories of Psychological Disorders

skill.text: 3.C: Interpret quantitative or qualitative inferential data from a given table, graph, chart, figure, or diagram.
